name: Baby Rubber Plant
climate: Thrives in tropical areas with high humidity to mimic its native environment.
Prefers temperatures between 65°F to 75°F for optimal growth.
Can tolerate low humidity but prefers moderate to high levels.
Not frost-tolerant; should be kept indoors in colder climates.
sunlight: Best suited for bright, indirect light indoors to thrive well.
Can tolerate lower light conditions but may grow more slowly.
Avoid direct sunlight as it can lead to leaf scorch and damage.
Rotate the plant regularly to ensure even growth from all angles.
watering: Allow the top inch of soil to dry out between waterings for best results.
Overwatering can lead to root rot, so ensure the pot has good drainage.
In winter, reduce watering frequency as the plant's growth slows.
Water thoroughly when the soil is dry, ensuring it reaches the roots.
soil: Prefers well-draining soil, such as a mix made for houseplants or succulents.
Soil should retain some moisture but not stay soggy or waterlogged.
A mix containing peat moss, perlite, and pine bark works well for aeration.
Repot every couple of years to refresh the soil and support healthy growth.
toxic: Mildly toxic to pets if ingested, can cause mouth and stomach irritation.
extra_care_tip: Wipe leaves regularly to remove dust and promote efficient photosynthesis.
